geyerhamplkocsis

Class KeywordCipher

  • java.lang.Object
    • geyerhamplkocsis.MonoalphabeticCipher
      • geyerhamplkocsis.KeywordCipher
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Cipher

    public class KeywordCipher
extends MonoalphabeticCipher
    To encrypt a String, this class will add a keyword in the beginning of the secret alphabet. If the Keyword contains Characters twice or illegal Characters were used, an IllegalArgumentException will be thrown. The case of the Characters will be ignored.
    Since:
    2014-02-15
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Stefan Geyer

      Constructors

      KeywordCipher(java.lang.String keyword)
      Generates a secret alphabet with the keyword in the beginning.

      • KeywordCipher

        public KeywordCipher(java.lang.String keyword)
        Generates a secret alphabet with the keyword in the beginning. Sets the secret alphabet in the MonoalphabeticCipher class.

      • validateKeyword

        public void validateKeyword(java.lang.String keyword)
                     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Checks if keyword is invalid and throws an IllegalArgumentException if needed
        Parameters:

        Throws:
